title: 03 August 2025
description: And the new music joy of discovery just keeps rolling on and out. This show features new releases from Adelaide's Sunsick Daisy, the late Nell Smith (UK), Winter McQuinn with friends Dylan Young and Acacia Pip etc  (Melb), Cloth (Glasgow), The Terrifying Lows (Melb), Hilltop Hoods (Ade), Kurt Vile & Luke Roberts (US), Folk Bitch Trio (Melb), Minor Gold (Bris), Dutch Mustard (UK via Netherlands), Carla Geneve (Perth), The Smith Street Band (Melb), Blood Orange feat Caroline Polachek (US) and Jess Ribeiro (Melb). Oh and there's a couple of 2019 tracks from Michelle Zauner aka japanese Breakfast incl a cover of Tears for Fears 1985 track ''Head Over Heels'.

title: 1994 Time Machine Special
description: Delving into the cave to drag out relics from 30 years ago. Featuring Soundgarden, Beck, Oasis, and local Australian indie gems from 1994.

title: Is it the Intonation?
description: This episode's Oblique Strategies prompt is "is the intonation wrong"? ....so Sandy, Nigel and Bernie spend two hours desperately trying to choose music to get close to this whole concept. Some try harder than others!!

title: Is there Something Missing?
description: Nigel, Sandy and Michael each have a different take on the theme of 'is there something missing' playing a range of wonderful tunes, questioning the relevance of each other's songs to the theme, and just enjoying sharing time together.

title: Quirky Weather Themes
description: A smorgasbord of musical delights brought together by our most nonsensical theme yet - weather songs that make you think of purple elephants.
Hear new music from Carla Geneve, Emily Wurramara, Radio Free Alice, Mulga Bore Hard Rock and more.

title: Best New Independent Australian Music
description: Playing the best new independent Australian music from Melbourne's underground scene, Brisbane's indie collectives, and Perth's emerging artists.

title: Folk Treasures from Down Under
description: An eclectic mix of traditional and contemporary folk from Australia, featuring bluegrass from the Blue Mountains and old timey tunes from Tasmania.

title: Americana Highway
description: World music meets contemporary folk in this journey through Americana, blues, and international acoustic sounds.

title: Classic Blues Masters
description: 2 hours of blues featuring classics from Muddy Waters, B.B. King, and interviews with contemporary independent blues artists keeping the tradition alive.

title: Independent Blues Showcase
description: Featuring interviews and music from independent blues artists, plus some classic tracks that influenced today's blues scene.

title: Roadhouse Blues & Roots
description: You supply the food and drink, we supply the tunes! Blues, roots, and alt-country to fuel your evening.

title: Alt-Country Highway
description: Tune in to hear what comes next - a journey through alt-country, roots, and blues that'll keep you guessing.

title: Gravel Road Sessions
show: Car Wheels on a Gravel Road
description: Seriously good driving music! Just a little bit country, mostly lots of Americana, Alt country, folk, rock and some blues.

title: Old Classics, New Brilliance
show: Car Wheels on a Gravel Road
description: A mix of old and new songs, great classics and up and coming brilliance from the worlds of folk, rock, and Americana.

title: Beatles & Eagles Special
description: Reliving the Baby Boomers era with influential artists like the Beatles and Eagles, plus bands who were influenced by them.

title: 60s & 70s Legacy
description: Classic rock from the baby boomer era, exploring the legacy of influential artists and their impact on music history.

title: Australian Independent Spotlight
description: Airing and interviewing independent/unsigned artists mainly of Australian origin, featuring fresh voices from the indie scene.

title: Emerging Aussie Talent
description: Interviews and music from unsigned Australian artists breaking new ground in indie, folk, and alternative genres.

title: Sunday Drive Blues
description: A big wheel keeps on turning on Sunday afternoon. Soul, country, swamp pop, Cajun, blues, rockabilly and good music for the highway.

title: Cajun & Rockabilly Mix
description: Covering soul, country, swamp pop, Cajun, blues, rockabilly. Hopefully you won't get lost on this musical highway.

title: Country Across the Eras
description: 3 hours of wall to wall country music from across the eras. Super informative and enthusiastic coverage of country's greatest hits.

title: Classic Country Chronicles
description: Weekly dose of country music spanning from classic honky-tonk to modern country, with enthusiastic commentary and artist stories.

title: World Music Quarterly
description: New music from around the world, featuring emerging artists from Europe, Asia, Africa, and the Americas.

title: Young Voices of Yackandandah
description: Wil, Raff, Hunter, Nico, Molly, Maeve, Will, Claudia, Lucas, Alfie, Henry and Felix offer a young person's view of the community.

title: Community Through Young Eyes
description: Year 5-6 students share their perspective on local events, school activities, and community happenings in Yackandandah.

title: Autumn Gardening Tips
description: Karen and Chrissie with the latest seasonal gardening tips for autumn planting and harvest preparations.

title: Women's Shed Community Update
description: Monthly update on the very active community group formed in late 2020, featuring recent projects and upcoming events.

Another ripper hour of Oz Rock, this time from this century. Starting in the 2000's with bands Faker, Taxiride & Blue King Brown we move onto later tunes from Courtney Barnett, Tame Impala, Kingswood, Moju, Alex Lahey and finish with tunes that are vibing just now from Press Club, Old Mervs, The Southern River Band, The Buoys and The Grogans. Far out! So many great beats in this crowded hour!
